strategy_reasoning: Google Summer of Code (GSoC) is about new growth and contributors. Using the garden metaphor fits perfectly with the 'pollinations' brand. We are visualizing the technical task of 'updating readmes' as 'tending the soil' to make it inviting for students.
visual_style: Cozy 8-bit pixel art, Studio Ghibli meets Stardew Valley. Chunky sprites, soft warm lighting, prominent lime green (#ecf874) accents.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a round chubby yellow pixel bee mascot with dark brown stripes and pink blush marks holding a tiny pixel rake, smoothing out a patch of digital soil. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and mint pastel gradient background. Chunky pixels, warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic like Stardew Valley. A small wooden sign nearby says 'GSoC'. Nostalgic, wholesome, welcoming.
images.description: The Bee mascot preparing the garden bed (documentation) for new seeds (students).

images.prompt: Close up pixel art of the cute bee mascot (round body, small wings) fixing a pixelated mailbox and polishing a sign that says 'CONTRIBUTING'. Soft lavender and peach gradient background with lime green (#ecf874) sparkles. Warm ambient glow, retro game UI vibes. The bee looks happy and helpful.
images.description: Visualizing the fix to the mentor contact email and contributing guide.

images.prompt: Wide pixel art shot of a flourishing digital garden. The bee mascot is flying happily above blooming pixel flowers that have computer code symbols on their petals. Soft lime green (#ecf874) sky with fluffy white pixel clouds. Warm, inviting atmosphere like A Short Hike. Text in pixel font at the bottom.
images.description: The result of good documentation: a blooming community.
